business.headline: Nvidia makes history, becomes first company to hit $4 trillion in market valueNvidia's market cap now exceeds the combined value of the Canadian and Mexican stock markets. It is also larger than the total market capitalisation of all publicly listed companies in the UK, according to LSEG data.

Emirates signs deal to accept crypto payments for flight bookings: ReportIn recent years, the UAE has grown into a popular place for crypto companies. Many crypto firms have opened offices there or are planning to expand. Today, people in the UAE can already use cryptocurrencies to pay for things like real estate, school fees and even transport services.
Sensex closes 176 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; HCLTech down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 176.43 points to 83,536.08, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 46.40 points to 25,476.10 as of 3:47 pm.

Reliance Jio IPO hits pause button, 2025 listing unlikely: ReportReliance Industries shares fell sharply after the news and were down 1.8% in afternoon trade, dragging the broader market into negative territory.

Sebi's ban on Jane Street: Could it rattle Dalal Street?While the ban is focused on a single player, many believe it may have wider effects on liquidity, trading volumes, investor confidence, and even foreign investor behaviour.

71% Indians fear AI scams during Prime Day: ReportPrime Day scams India, AI shopping scams 2025, McAfee Prime Day scam report, Fake Amazon websites India, online shopping scam awareness, AI scam protection tips, Prime Day fake deals warning, Indians fear online scams, cyber fraud Prime Day India, deepfake scams online shopping

Travel Food Services IPO to close soon: Should you subscribe? Check latest GMPThe bidding for the IPO began on July 7 and is set to close soon. Travel Food Services has set the price band for the issue between Rs 1,045 and Rs 1,100 per share.

ITR filing: Who qualifies for zero income tax?In her 2025 Budget speech, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman shared big news. Under the new regime, if you earn up to Rs 12 lakh, you will not have to pay any income tax. Salaried taxpayers get an extra benefit too.

Infosys, TCS, Wipro: Will top IT companies gain momentum in Q1FY26?Equirus Securities, in its earnings preview, signals a subdued performance for the sector, where even the heavyweights are struggling to regain momentum.

Mutual fund inflows rise 24% in June to Rs 23,587 crore: AMFI dataAmong the 11 equity mutual fund categories, all except equity-linked savings schemes (ELSS) recorded positive inflows. Flexi cap funds emerged as the most preferred option for investors, bringing in Rs 5,733 crore in June.

9 countries where Indians can get citizenship for less than Rs 1 croreAcross many countries, it is now fully legal to buy citizenship. With a single payment or donation, Indians can get a fresh passport that offers visa-free access and minimal global taxes.

ICICI Prudential Asset Management files for IPO. Check offer detailsThe IPO will be an offer for sale of up to 1.77 crore shares, representing 10% of the company's equity share capital. The shares will be sold by Prudential Corporation Holdings Limited (PCHL), a wholly-owned subsidiary of UK-based insurer Prudential.

entertainment.headline: Diljit Dosanjh shares new BTS from Border 2, Varun Dhawan-Ahan Shetty make cameoDespite the row over his casting in 'Border 2', Diljit Dosanjh seems unfazed. The actor is enjoying himself on set, as seen in his latest video.

Who was Humaira Asghar Ali, the Pakistani actor found dead at home?Pakistani actor and model Humaira Asghar Ali was found dead in her Karachi apartment, with the cause of death still under investigation. Known for her roles in TV dramas and the film 'Jalaibee', she gained fame through the reality show 'Tamasha Ghar'.

Siddu Jonnalagadda turns raw and intense for Badass, makers unveil posterAfter the massive success of the 'Tillu' franchise, Siddu Jonnalagadda is set to shed the lingering image with 'Badass', a raw, intense film directed by Ravikanth Perepu. The makers released the first-look poster recently.

Slow Horses renewed: Gary Oldman's spy-thriller upgraded for seventh seasonActor Gary Oldman's British spy-thriller series 'Slow Horses' has been renewed for the seventh season. The show is based on Mick Herron's spy novel series 'Slough House'.

Mahavatar Narsimha trailer: Lord Vishnu and Prahald's epic tale comes aliveThe trailer for 'Mahavatar Narsimha' has been unveiled, showcasing a grand and emotional depiction of a pivotal mythological tale centred on Prahlada's devotion and divine intervention. Set to release in 3D across five Indian languages in July 2025, the film also marks the beginning of the ambitious Mahavatar Cinematic Universe.

Ali Fazal surprises fans at Metro In Dino screening, video goes viralAli Fazal surprised fans with an unannounced visit to a theatre screening of 'Metro... In Dino', leaving the audience thrilled and the moment going viral. The film is already receiving a positive response from viewers.

What to expect from James Gunn's Superman, and why watching Man of Steel is crucialJames Gunn's 'Superman' might bring a new and exciting look, full of action and visuals, but might not go too deep into the characters. However, watching 'Man of Steel' before can help you understand the background better.

John Cena jokes Margot Robbie's Barbie was a mistake that happened over dinnerHollywood star John Cena landed a role in the 2023 hit 'Barbie' through an unexpected meeting at a dinner hosted by Margot Robbie. He appeared in a cameo role in the Oscar-nominated film.

Four Years Later tops OTT romance this weekend, here's all about Shahana's showActor Shahana Goswami's Australian-Indian romantic-drama 'Four Years Later' is all set for its digital debut in India. The series explores the emotional and cultural challenges faced by a migrant couple in an arranged marriage. Here's when and where to binge-watch the show.

Ballard OTT guide: Cast, story, and what to expect from Bosch spinoffOTT's 'The Bosch' spin-off 'Ballard' dives deep into cold cases and corruption. The show premiered on July 9.  Here's all about it.

All about Charlize Theron's The Old Guard 2, Netflix film trending amid poor reviews'The Old Guard 2', headlined by Charlize Theron, has taken over the top spot on Netflix's global top 10 movies for the week. The film ranked number 1 on Netflix in 74 countries, including India.

Timothee Chalamet and Zendaya's Dune 3 official title confirmed: ReportsDenis Villeneuve's 'Dune 3' has entered production. The film's official title has been confirmed and, contrary to fans' predictions, it's not 'Dune Messiah'. Find out more details here.

Actor Shiva Rajkumar channels vintage spy look in 666 Operation Dream TheatreThe makers of '666 Operation Dream Theatre' unveiled Shiva Rajkumar's first look. Directed by Hemanth Rao, the film is said to be a spy action thriller. The retro styling and tone hint at a tribute to old-school espionage dramas.

Jeetu bhaiya, Jaideep Ahlawat, Jackson Wang promise fun on Kapil's show. WatchActors Jaideep Ahlawat, Pratik Gandhi, Jeetendra Kumar and Vijay Varma will feature in the next episode of 'The Great Indian Kapil Show'. K-Pop singer Jackson Wang would also make an appearance in the episode.

Freedom review: Sasikumar's action drama, based on true story, is lost opportunityRelease Date:Wed Jul 09, 2025Freedom movie review: Director Sathyasiva's 'Freedom', based on a true incident about Sri Lankan refugees, features Sasikumar, Lijomol Jose and Sudev Nair. The film has a solid story at its core, but is bogged down by sloppy execution.
Rajkummar Rao-Patralekhaa announce pregnancy, celebs congratulateRajkummar Rao and Patralekhaa announced pregnancy on July 9. The couple shared a joint post on Instagram.

Sai Pallavi, Junaid Khan's Ek Din to release in November: ReportThe upcoming film, 'Ek Din', starring Junaid Khan and Sai Pallavi, is set for release in November. Directed by Sunil Pandey, it will mark Pallavi's Bollywood debut.

Who is Vedika Shetty? Alia Bhatt's ex-assistant arrested for alleged fraudAlia Bhatt's former personal assistant, Vedika Prakash Shetty, has been arrested by Juhu Police following allegations of cheating the actor and her production house of over Rs 76 lakh. Know more about the former assistant.

Rashami Desai slams paps for inappropriate video of Neha Bhasin: You have no respectActor Rashami Desai criticised paparazzi for disrespecting Neha Bhasin in a recent viral video. She expressed disappointment over filming Bhasin from behind, despite her objections.

general news.headline: Trump's tariff letters to 7 more nations: Iraq, Algeria and Sri Lanka face 30%The new tariff directives, communicated via official letters to foreign leaders and shared on Trump's Truth Social platform, outline duty hikes of 30 per cent on Algeria, Iraq, and Libya; 25 per cent on Brunei and Moldova; and 20 per cent on the Philippines.

Arvind Kejriwal says he deserves Nobel prize, BJP suggests 'corruption category'Speaking in Chandigarh at the launch of the Punjabi edition of a book titled 'The Kejriwal Model', the AAP supremo said that despite repeated attempts to obstruct his government's work in Delhi, his administration had delivered effectively.

Bridge collapses in Gujarat, 13 dead as vehicles plunge, truck hangs by a threadGujarat Bridge Collapse: Preliminary information indicated at least five vehicles had fallen into the river after the bridge collapse. Calling the incident 'deeply saddening,' Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel said that one of the 23 spans of the nearly 900-metre-long bridge had collapsed.

Elon Musk's Starlink gets approval to operate internet satellites over IndiaThe rollout of Starlink's services will, however, remain subject to all relevant regulatory clearances, approvals, and licenses from government departments.

Amit Shah shares post-retirement plan: Vedas, Upanishads and farmingUnion Home Minister Amit Shah recently revealed his post-retirement plans. The sixty-year-old task-master said he would immerse himself in Vedas, Upanishads, and natural farming. Citing health risks linked to the use of chemical fertilisers, Shah batted for the promotion of organic farming.

Day 10 Live: Sinner beats Shelton to reach semis, Djokovic bounces backWimbledon 2025, Day 10 Updates: Jannik Sinner has no problems with his elbow. He takes out Ben Shelton in straight sets to reach the semi-final for the 2nd set. Meanwhile, Novak Djokovic is in a spot of bother, losing the opening set in the tie-breaker to Flavio Cobolli.

Water bomb for India, Arunachal Chief Minister warns as China builds 'mega dam'According to reports, China approved the construction of the USD 137 billion, five-year project in 2024. It is projected to produce 60,000 MW of power, making it the world's largest hydropower dam.

US hikes student, tourist, H-1B visa charges with $250 security depositNon-immigrant visa applicants, including students, professionals, and tourists, will have to pay a $250 "Integrity Fee", along with other travel-related fees, starting in 2026, to enter the US. The fee might be refunded under certain conditions, but will change annually as it is based on inflation rates.

My son is drowning: Mother's desperate cry for help after Gujarat bridge collapseAccording to information gathered from the site, the woman had been travelling to Bagdana along with her son, daughter, husband, and son-in-law when the bridge gave way.

Maharashtra suspends MLA canteen licence after Sena MLA hits staff over stale dalThe licence of the MLA canteen was suspended a day after Shiv Sena MLA Sanjay Gaikwad was caught on camera slapping and punching a staff member over stale food.

Wimbledon: Not pain free, but Jannik Sinner breezes past Ben Shelton into semisJannik Sinner fought through pain to make it to the semi-finals of Wimbledon 2025 by beating Ben Shelton in straight sets on Wednesday, July 9. Sinner breezed past Shelton in two hours and 19 minutes on Wednesday.

Long queues at Mysuru hospital as people panic over rise in heart attack casesRecent media reports about a surge in heart attack-related deaths in Karnataka, especially in Hassan, has triggered panic among the public. Thousands have been queueing up daily at Jayadeva Hospital in Mysuru for cardiac check-ups, prompting doctors to urge calm and lifestyle changes.
Samsung launches ultra-thin Galaxy Z Fold 7 and Flip 7Samsung has unveiled three new foldable smartphones — Galaxy Z Fold 7, Flip 7, and Flip 7 FE — at its Unpacked 2025 event in New York, USA.

Linda Yaccarino steps down as X CEO after two yearsLinda Yaccarino has resigned as CEO of X after nearly two years, ending her leadership run marked by platform changes, ad business challenges, and Elon Musk's push for an "everything app".

Did Centre know? Priyank Kharge flags report of 'young BJP MP' meeting TrumpIn a lengthy post on X, the Karnataka minister asked pointed questions about how the 'young BJP MP' bypassed diplomatic protocols and demanded accountability.
Video: PM Modi gets standing ovation in Namibia ParliamentPrime Minister Narendra Modi received a standing ovation ahead of his address to the Parliament of Namibia.
Rajkummar Rao-Patralekhaa announce pregnancy, celebs congratulateRajkummar Rao and Patralekhaa announced pregnancy on July 9. The couple shared a joint post on Instagram.
Roads flooded, traffic crawls as Delhi-NCR receives heavy rainSeveral roads were waterlogged, causing traffic jams after heavy rain lashed Delhi-NCR on Wednesday evening.

Aadhaar isn't proof of citizenship. Then how does it fetch voting rights?The Election Commission is holding an intensive revision of voter rolls across India, beginning with Bihar, to update them and weed out non-citizens. But why did India allow non-citizens to get into the rolls in the first place? Form 6, which people fill to register as voters, doesn't demand proof of citizenship in the first place.

Chhangur Baba a criminal, played with women's dignity: Yogi Adityanath lauds arrestUttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath said that the acts of the arrested mastermind of religious conversion mastermind Chhangur Baba were anti-national and anti-social.

Treated like criminals: Indian tourist, held in Russia with others, seeks helpAn Indian tourist detained by Moscow immigration authorities with eight others appealed to the Indian embassy and Prime Minister Narendra Modi to intervene.

2 pilots killed in IAF Jaguar jet crash in Rajasthan, third incident in 5 monthsSources told India Today TV that the aircraft was on a training sortie when it went down. The IAF operates multiple air bases in Rajasthan, with major installations in Jodhpur and Bikaner.

Why Xi Jinping's abrupt absence has sparked global speculationWhether it's illness, pressing preoccupation or sidelining by his own system, one thing is clear: China may be entering a period of political uncertainty

How Goa archives plans to give state's rich past a safe futureA unique initiative is underway to unearth historical manuscripts, letters and private collections dating back to the colonial era and safe-keep them in digitised format

Diljit Dosanjh shares new BTS from Border 2, Varun Dhawan-Ahan Shetty make cameoDespite the row over his casting in 'Border 2', Diljit Dosanjh seems unfazed. The actor is enjoying himself on set, as seen in his latest video.

Known for her roles in TV dramas and the film 'Jalaibee', she gained fame through the reality show 'Tamasha Ghar'.

Slow Horses renewed: Gary Oldman's spy-thriller upgraded for seventh seasonActor Gary Oldman's British spy-thriller series 'Slow Horses' has been renewed for the seventh season. The show is based on Mick Herron's spy novel series 'Slough House'.

sports.headline: Italy on cusp of historic T20 World Cup spot after stunning ScotlandItaly defeated Scotland by 12 runs on Wednesday and are on the verge of making their way through to the Men's T20 World Cup to be held next year.

Wimbledon: Not pain free, but Jannik Sinner breezes past Ben Shelton into semisJannik Sinner fought through pain to make it to the semi-finals of Wimbledon 2025 by beating Ben Shelton in straight sets on Wednesday, July 9. Sinner breezed past Shelton in two hours and 19 minutes on Wednesday.

Real Madrid vs PSG, FIFA Club World Cup semi-final: Where to watch in IndiaReal Madrid take on PSG in a blockbuster Club World Cup semi-final, where Kylian Mbappe faces his former club. With Chelsea waiting in the final, it's all to play for at MetLife.

Lyon saved from Ligue 1 relegation, but Crystal Palace suffer blow to Europe hopesLyon has been saved from Ligue 1 relegation as their appeal to overturn the decision was made on Wednesday, July 9. However, this has put Crystal Palace's participation in the Europa League under doubt as both clubs belong to the same owners.

Mom last year, Wimbledon semis this year: Belinda Bencic continues magical runWimbledon 2025: Belinda Bencic, 28, has reached the semi-finals of the grass-court Grand Slam for the first time in her career. Remarkably, she has climbed back into the top 20 just six months after starting the season ranked No. 487.

Belinda Bencic emulates Roger Federer, Swiatek fights into maiden semisWimbledon: Belinda Bencic and Iga Swiatek stormed into the semi-finals of the grass-court major after beating Mirra Andreeva and Liudmila Samsonova on Wednesday.

Verstappen sends emotional message to Horner after Red Bull sackingMax Verstappen sent an emotional message to Christian Horner after he was sacked as the team principal of Red Bull Racing on Wednesday, July 9. Horner left his role after 20 years with Red Bull.

Rishabh Pant explains stump-mic chatter: Some banter, mostly coachingEngland vs India, 3rd Test: Speaking to the press on the eve of the Lord's Test, vice-captain Rishabh Pant shed light on his habit to talk to himself while batting in the middle. With 342 runs in two Tests, Pant has been in fine form with the bat in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy.

Lord's Test, India's playing XI: Bumrah returns, but will Arshdeep also play?With Jasprit Bumrah all set to make his return to the playing XI for the Lord's Test, it will be interesting to see if India will be tempted to add a fourth pacer to their lineup. This opens the door for Arshdeep Singh to make his debut in Tests.

Did India force England to change Lord's pitch plan? Rishabh Pant reactsRishabh Pant said that the Indian team isn't thinking about England are planning with the Lord's pitch ahead of the third Test, which begins from July 10. A lot of talk has been about the Lord's pitch, which seemed to be on the greener side as compared to the tracks for the first two Tests.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
